alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:26PM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cherokee, Polk and south central Monroe Counties through 115 PM EST... At 1226 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Benton to 8 miles southeast of Wildwood Lake. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Benton, Ducktown, William L. Davenport Refuge, Coker Creek, Violet, Conasauga, Big Frog Mountain, Parksville, Turtletown and Copperhill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for southwestern North Carolina...and east Tennessee.
